title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Each military installation selected for closure or substantial realignment under a base closure law shall be designated as an enterprise zone by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The designated enterprise zone shall include the local community within the jurisdiction of the military installation. Additionally, the Secretary of Commerce shall designate the military installation as a redevelopment area. Each military installation selected for closure or realignment under a base closure law will be designated as an enterprise zone by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The Secretary of Commerce will also designate the installation as a redevelopment area within the local community's jurisdiction. Designations must be made within 60 days of the installation being recommended for closure or realignment in a base closure report to Congress by the President. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will designate military installations recommended for closure or realignment as enterprise zones within 60 days of the base closure report being transmitted to Congress. Additionally, the Secretary of Commerce will designate the installations as redevelopment areas in the local community's jurisdiction. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will designate military installations for closure or realignment as enterprise zones within 60 days of the enactment of this Act. These designated enterprise zones will be in addition to the 100 authorized enterprise zones under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. Economic adjustment assistance or community planning assistance for these zones may be funded from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or the Secretary of Commerce. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 allows for military installations to be designated as enterprise zones, with funding for economic adjustment or community planning assistance from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce. The designation remains in effect for 5 years, with annual reviews conducted by the Secretary of Commerce to ensure compliance with the requirements of the Act. The Secretary of Commerce conducts annual reviews of designated enterprise zones under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. The designation lasts for 5 years and can be terminated or modified if the area no longer meets the requirements. Definitions for "base closure law" and "substantial realignment" are provided in the section. The term "substantial realignment" refers to a significant reduction in military installation operations where 50% or more of personnel are reassigned. This definition is provided in the context of annual reviews conducted by the Secretary of Commerce for designated enterprise zones under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certain certifications are met regarding commercial use priorities. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to require certifications from the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Commerce before military installation properties can be used for commercial or redevelopment purposes.
